description: Extension to the DAP to support additional features.
title: Custom Debug Adapter Protocol

allOf.description: Response to 'setPydevdSourceMap' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.
The event indicates input was requested by debuggee.
The request can be used retrieve system information, python version, etc.

___dontTraceStartPatterns.description: Patterns to match with the start of the file paths. Matching paths will be added to a list of file where trace is ignored.

___skipPrintBreakpointException.description: List of exceptions that should skip printing to stderr when doing condition evaluations.

___skipSuspendOnBreakpointException.description: List of exceptions that should be skipped when doing condition evaluations.

___dontTraceEndPatterns.description: Patterns to match with the end of the file paths. Matching paths will be added to a list of file where trace is ignored.

___ideOS.description: OS where the ide is running. Supported values [Windows, Linux]

___multiThreadsSingleNotification.description: If false then a notification is generated for each thread event. If true a single event is gnenerated, and all threads follow that behavior.

_88PydevdSourceMap.description: Information that allows mapping a local line to a remote source/line.

___runtimeSource.description: The path that the user has remotely -- 'source.path' must be specified (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this could be something as '<ipython-input-1-4561234>')

___line.description: The local line to which the mapping should map to (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this would be the first line of the cell in the file).

___runtimeLine.description: The remote line to which the mapping should map to (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this would be always 1 as it'd map the start of the cell).

_88PydevdPythonImplementationInfo.description: This object contains python implementation details.

___description.description: Optional description for this python implementation.

___version.description: Python version as a string in semver format: <major>.<minor>.<micro><releaselevel><serial>.

$eref.description: This object contains python process details.

___ppid.description: Parent Process ID for the current process.

___executable.description: Path to the executable as returned by 'sys.executable'.

___bitness.description: Integer value indicating the bitness of the current process.

___pid.description: Process ID for the current process.

$eref.description: This object contains python version and implementation details.

___name.description: Name of the platform as returned by 'sys.platform'.

___platform.description: Information about the plarforn on which the current process is running.

$eref.description: This object contains python version and implementation details.

___version.description: Python version as a string in semver format: <major>.<minor>.<micro><releaselevel><serial>.

___implementation.description: Python version as a string in this format <major>.<minor>.<micro><releaselevel><serial>.

___python.description: Information about the python version running in the current process.

$eref.description: This object contains details on pydevd.

___usingFrameEval.description: Specifies whether the frame eval native module is being used.

___usingCython.description: Specifies whether the cython native module is being used.

_88PydevdPlatformInfo.description: This object contains python version and implementation details.

___name.description: Name of the platform as returned by 'sys.platform'.

___pydevdSourceMaps.description: The PydevdSourceMaps to be set to the given source (provide an empty array to clear the source mappings for a given path).

$eref.description: Information that allows mapping a local line to a remote source/line.

___runtimeSource.description: The path that the user has remotely -- 'source.path' must be specified (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this could be something as '<ipython-input-1-4561234>')

___line.description: The local line to which the mapping should map to (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this would be the first line of the cell in the file).

___runtimeLine.description: The remote line to which the mapping should map to (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this would be always 1 as it'd map the start of the cell).

___source.description: The source location of the PydevdSourceMap; 'source.path' must be specified (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this could be something as /home/notebook/note.py).

___clientAccessToken.description: The access token to access the client (i.e.: usually the IDE).

allOf.description: Response to 'setDebuggerProperty' request. This is just an acknowledgement, so no body field is required.

description: Sets multiple PydevdSourceMap for a single source and clears all previous PydevdSourceMap in that source.
i.e.: Maps paths and lines in a 1:N mapping (use case: map a single file in the IDE to multiple IPython cells).
To clear all PydevdSourceMap for a source, specify an empty array.
Interaction with breakpoints: When a new mapping is sent, breakpoints that match the source (or previously matched a source) are reapplied.
Interaction with launch pathMapping: both mappings are independent. This mapping is applied after the launch pathMapping.

___pydevdSourceMaps.description: The PydevdSourceMaps to be set to the given source (provide an empty array to clear the source mappings for a given path).

___source.description: The source location of the PydevdSourceMap; 'source.path' must be specified (e.g.: for an ipython notebook this could be something as /home/notebook/note.py).

allOf.description: The request can be used to enable or disable debugger features.

___dontTraceStartPatterns.description: Patterns to match with the start of the file paths. Matching paths will be added to a list of file where trace is ignored.

___skipPrintBreakpointException.description: List of exceptions that should skip printing to stderr when doing condition evaluations.

___skipSuspendOnBreakpointException.description: List of exceptions that should be skipped when doing condition evaluations.

___dontTraceEndPatterns.description: Patterns to match with the end of the file paths. Matching paths will be added to a list of file where trace is ignored.

___ideOS.description: OS where the ide is running. Supported values [Windows, Linux]

___multiThreadsSingleNotification.description: If false then a notification is generated for each thread event. If true a single event is gnenerated, and all threads follow that behavior.

___usingFrameEval.description: Specifies whether the frame eval native module is being used.

allOf.description: A request to authorize the ide to start accepting commands.

___debugServerAccessToken.description: The access token to access the debug server.
